attributes.action: Limit Secondary school rolls to under 1000 pupils. This will help ensure effective management, positive ethos, community spirit and a suitable learning/development environment for young adults and those who work there.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Big schools are rarely able to be managed effectively,  and so creating positive ethos, community spirit and a suitable learning/development environment for young adults, is virtually impossible.  Sheer numbers and sizes of buildings mean a great deal of time is wasted - for example - the movement between lessons.  Discipline is more difficult as many teachers and pupils remain unknown throughout the school.  A pupil can burst into a classroom or swearing at teachers in corridors etc without being accurately identifiable.  We can effectively tailor learning to individuals when those individuals are known throughout the school and recognised as a person rather than someone in 2nd yr!
SMT have more chance of supporting staff in a smaller school where again the sense of team spirit and someone taking the time to "know" you makes all the difference.  I have worked in several schools of varying sizes and have children of my own. All feedback I get from parents, teachers, pupils, etc indicates that large schools simply do NOT work.
